TopicTitle: Land Rover V8 short-wheelbase open-top and Hardtop

Articles.Content:
*EDIT*: I have added the hardtop version too.

Thanks!

MJ

Hi all!

Ive been looking at all the awesome cars floating around on the forums and have been inspired to make my own for driving challenges and such.

So I made one of my favorite 4x4s The land Rover V8, short-wheelbase

I made a detailed little interior for the car with steering wheel and boss, wing mirrors, gear stick and two little seats.

There are even brake lights when you use the button!

Now with authentic "candles in jam-jars" headlights.

There is even a little electric V8 under the bonnet.

Oh, and a spare wheel.

I discovered that a popped tire will not repair due to the weight of the car. You need to position a freindy Kerbal under the car to take some of the weight!

The Land Rover has a top speed on the flat of around 45 MPH.

Take care on hills, control your speed, usual rover rules apply.

You will of course want to put kerbals inside so I attached a two Kerbal pod for easy crew transfer.

Action group 5 is the antenna

Javascript is disabled. View full album

DOWNLOAD OPEN-TOP

DOWNLOAD HARD-TOP

Edited June 16, 2014 by Majorjim
I like it! You should make more!
Wow, a work of art! Would be cool to drive that on the dunes of Laythe.

This is perfectly timed for the release of Spintires tomorrow.

Edit: In CST It came out a day early!!!!! So this is perfectly timed.
But the "Land Rover" in Spintires is actually a UAZ 31512...
Yeah, but that's close enough.

Can't tell the difference between this and that Open-top Landrover.

Waiting to see the Closed-top Landrover.

http://i.imgur.com/RUaivPJ.png

Can't tell the difference between this and that Open-top Landrover.

Waiting to see the Closed-top Landrover.

He he, cool! Im working on a different version too.

Also, spintires looks so much fun!

It does look amazing, and...

"electric V8"??? x-)

You know what? I think KSP should be more that just a space simulator.

It does look amazing, and...

"electric V8"??? x-)

You know what? I think KSP should be more that just a space simulator.

LOL yeah! I made the engine out of batteries and an RTG. And it looks like a V8 so its an electric V8.

The Kerbals are a very progressive species.

Edited June 13, 2014 by Majorjim
Personally, i prefer RTG SPAM over Batteries.

Personally, i prefer RTG SPAM over Batteries.

In this case, one was enough. I used the batteries for asthetic effect such as the cargo in the boot and the rear lights. (That just gave me a thought)

BRB
Really nice job man, i was wondering if we could team up?

Hi all,

I have updated the Land Rover a little. I added break lights when you use them and I changed the properties of the headlights to more realistically reflect the

"Candles in jam-jars" lights that where on the old land Rovers.

Oh,

And I added a two man pod to the car so its easy to load two crew.

Pics in the first post.

Thanks!

MJ

Really nice job man, i was wondering if we could team up?

Hello Vagani!

I'm really flattered you asked and I am very tempted. What would it entail?
You can just join in, share ideas, give each other credit, improve each others vehicles and give each other tips. Flattered, wow am I that good
This is really great work. Making good looking cars and trucks in KSP is not easy!

This is really great work. Making good looking cars and trucks in KSP is not easy!

Thanks Gus. The first few versions were a mess though!
So are you in?

This is really great work. Making good looking cars and trucks in KSP is not easy!

They're based off of european trucks of course.

You could try making your own trucks.

Infact, there is a dead challenge thread which was supposed to have you racing around in trucks ( http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/75326-KRF-Truck-Racing-League )

the OP never came back, but the trucks are still there! Though most of them are american. (i only remember 1 other truck design that wasn't mine and was european, seemed like the newer volvo)
